Confluence has no way to link a Custom Content definition to the add-on name that provides it.

fields.description: The login webhook from Confluence Cloud in developer mode gives the “remoteIP” attribute as  127.0.0.1. This could be for several reasons, but can be fixed in Server by reconfiguring Tomcat. Obviously this is not possible for our Cloud customers/vendors.
fields.summary: Login webhook has remoteIP value of localhost
CQL filtered by content string property only works without quotes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#efefef}
Confluence add-ons are being moved from our older P2 plugins framework over to our more modern [Connect framework|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFCLOUD]. The overall result will be better performance and functionality in Confluence Cloud. It does, however, mean that we’ll occasionally need to deprecate functionality that was previously available.

In this case, it won’t be possible to link to the anchor macro when it’s embedded within a macro provided by a Connect add-on. Links to anchors of this type will instead link to the relevant page rather than linking directly to the specific area of the content where the anchor is positioned.

h3. What can I do?

If the anchor doesn't need to be inside the body of the Connect macro, we suggest moving it outside the macro and to a relevant location on the page.

If you have any concerns or questions, please feel free to comment on this issue.
{panel}

h3. The technical info

Confluence Cloud macros (dynamic macros) are rendered inside an iframe. If the macro tries to render an anchor link, or includes a macro that generates an anchor link, the link can't be navigated to using the standard hash tag navigation.

For example:
# Create a dynamic macro (any dynamic macro will expose this issue).
# Insert an anchor macro (this will render a named anchor in to the page)

Result: 
* Expected: navigating to the page with #anchorName should scroll to the anchor
* Actual: the #anchorName is ignored and the page is not scrolled

Reason:
* The anchor is rendered inside the iframe and scrolling to anchors contained in child iframes isn't supported by default.
fields.summary: Unable to navigate to anchor links inside Connect Macros

fields.description:
Our Archiving Plugin for Confluence is creating new pages. 

At each page-create, Synchrony in Confluence 6.0.1 writes the following 2 lines:
{noformat}
2016-11-10 09:36:40,537 INFO [scheduler_Worker-2] [synchrony.service.http.SynchronyRequestExecutor] execute Initiating request PUT http://localhost:8091/synchrony/v1/data/Midori-Global-Consulting-Kft-8f60600b-51a0-364c-8c6d-0abe2d16f418/confluence-1868135?state-at=@head&state-format=html HTTP/1.1 for 1868135
2016-11-10 09:36:40,547 WARN [scheduler_Worker-2] [synchrony.service.http.SynchronyResponseHandler] failed Synchrony external changes API call returned 401: {"type":"unauthorized-access","message":"Not authorized to access this resource."} content-id: 1868135 rev: confluence$content$1868135.3 ancestor: null merges: {"confVersion":"1","trigger":"other","type":"external"} generate-rev: null generate-reset: null
{noformat}

Why does Synchrony affected by pages created by the "backend"? 
(There is no collaborative editing involved around page creations, so this should be transparent for Synchrony, I guess.)
fields.summary: Synchrony writes warnings to our Confluence 6 log at page creations
404 errors when displaying Connect macro within 'excerpt-include' macro

fields.description:
Hello, 

I am writing you because I have a few questions regarding the Confluence API's.

We are trying to find a way to do the following, programmatically: 
1. Our Confluence (5.5) is connected to Ms Active Directory. When an user is disabled in AD, Confluence disables that user as well. But if we switch the user back to Active in AD, Confluence doesn't sync that and the user remains disabled in Confluence. We are trying to find a way to enable the user in Confluence automatically. 
Q: Is there an API to achieve this other than XML-RPC, which is deprecated? 

2. User's Profile Picture is not synced with our Active Directory. 
Q: Is there an API to achieve this? 

Looking forward for your answer. 

Thanks, 
Andrei

fields.description:
When navigating straight to the url of a space tools tab, the highlighted tab defaults to whichever tab was highlighted last. If no previous tab has been navigated to, the entire tab bar will be missing.

1. Incorrect highlighted tab
 - install an add-on with a space tools tab module.
 - navigate to the add-on's space tools tab and copy the url.
 - click on any other space tools tab.
 - paste the copied url.

The add-on's iframe will be displayed, but the highlighted tab will still be the other one.

2. No tab bar
 - install Play SQL Spreadsheets for Confluence
 - navigate to a space overview
 - click "Spreadsheets" in the left nav bar (this is a web item with a hardcoded link to the space tools tab)

The iframe will display, but there will be no second-level tab bar.
fields.summary: Space Tools Tab doesn't highlight correct tab when navigating to page directly
Navigator context API doesn't get context of blogposts

fields.description:
If you look at the return type of com.atlassian.plugin.connect.confluence.byline.ContentBylineWebResourceDataProvider#buildMap you will see that it is a Map<String, String> where the key is the contentPropertyKey and the value is the ContentBylineItem complete key that that contentPropertyKey should update.

However, this is wrong, the return type should be Map<String, Collection<String>> because every contentPropertyKey could have multiple byline items relying upon it; they could even be separate byline items from different add-ons.

We should fix the JS code and the data provider so that it is possible to have multiple byline items that reference the same content property. Currently only whichever the 'last' byline item happens to be will actually work from the JS side.
fields.summary: Content Byline Items cannot handle two byline items that refer to the same contentPropertyKey
Revert MAX_BODY_LENGTH

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*

# Upload an attachment containing a character which needs to be encoded for inclusion in a URI query component, but not for a path component, e.g. colon or parentheses.
# Make a request to {{/rest/api/content/\[content-id\]/child/attachment}}

*Actual Results*

The response field {{_links.download}} for the attachment contains the path to the file encoded using application/x-www-form-urlencoded. If used directly within a Connect add-on, query-string hash validation fails in Confluence.

*Workaround*

Decode the download path using application/x-www-form-urlencoded. Reencode it as a URI path.

*Original Description*

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/atlassian-connect-dev/zhMT6ITI-Ok

I created an attachment with ':' in the filename and try to download to add-on server. URL from '/rest/api/content/\{id\}/child/attachment': /download/attachments/35946500/2016-04-04T06%3A17%3A40.842Z.png?version=1&modificationDate=1459750715126&api=v2

Error: Expecting claim 'qsh' to have value '14c07ff61801eb73010d9e7a8aa0182f41ec8334dc2ec8b78d627cf01a29997e' but instead it has the value '4dbb8612f7b20148bf4737618573310539004829d714de8869c9c2a94502fa2f'

If I replace '%3A' with ':' the call works (either work on local Confluence).
fields.summary: Attachment resource returns application/x-www-form-urlencoded download paths
Enable chromeless dialogs for custom macro editors

fields.description:
Using the search REST API: https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest/#content-search.

Reference documentation: https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-server-rest-api/advanced-searching-using-cql/performing-text-searches-using-cql

Specifically:

Note: All query terms in Confluence are case insensitive.

The following CQL produce different results. The first finds content and the second does not.

They should find the same content when the existing page is commentPage:

{code}
type=page and space=ztp and title=commentPage
type=page and space=ztp and title=COMMENTPage
{code}

This is on bobswift13.atlassian.net, but I don't think that the instance matters.
We have found other examples where it is case-insensitive. Similarly, it appears to be case insensitive on space name but now, given the above results, we are no longer confident in that either.
fields.summary: Case sensitivity in CQL using REST API

fields.description:
Our plugins are taking too long to execute the PluginController's enablePluginModule method

Here is the snippet of our log:
{code}
2016-07-19 16:21:10,494 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [confluence.util.profiling.DurationThresholdWarningTimingHelperFactory] logMessage Execution time for publishing event com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.plugin.AsyncPluginModuleEnableEvent[source=com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.EventDispatchingPluginController@44a983a9] took 6890 ms (warning threshold is 5000 ms)
 -- url: /plugins/pageapproval/approvePage.action | referer: http://localhost:8090/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1048578 | traceId: 70c9d4fbb2c86ab1 | userName: admin | action: approvePage
2016-07-19 16:21:17,626 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [confluence.util.profiling.DurationThresholdWarningTimingHelperFactory] logMessage Execution time for publishing event com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.plugin.AsyncPluginModuleEnableEvent[source=com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.EventDispatchingPluginController@44a983a9] took 7095 ms (warning threshold is 5000 ms)
 -- url: /plugins/pageapproval/approvePage.action | referer: http://localhost:8090/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1048578 | traceId: 70c9d4fbb2c86ab1 | userName: admin | action: approvePage
2016-07-19 16:21:24,788 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [confluence.util.profiling.DurationThresholdWarningTimingHelperFactory] logMessage Execution time for publishing event com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.plugin.AsyncPluginModuleEnableEvent[source=com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.EventDispatchingPluginController@44a983a9] took 7083 ms (warning threshold is 5000 ms)
 -- url: /plugins/pageapproval/approvePage.action | referer: http://localhost:8090/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1048578 | traceId: 70c9d4fbb2c86ab1 | userName: admin | action: approvePage
2016-07-19 16:21:31,671 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [confluence.util.profiling.DurationThresholdWarningTimingHelperFactory] logMessage Execution time for publishing event com.atlassian.confluence.event.events.plugin.AsyncPluginModuleEnableEvent[source=com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.EventDispatchingPluginController@44a983a9] took 6821 ms (warning threshold is 5000 ms)
{code}

I believe this issue is related to [CONF-42808|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-42808] as the error message looks almost the same, however 5.10.2 does not fix our issue.

1. This issue is triggered when we have implementation in our plugin that used PluginController to enable quite a few plugin modules (~50 modules).
2. This issue only happens in 5.10, 5.10.1 and 5.10.2, it works fine on 5.5-5.9.
3. We discovered this issue from the MenuManager plugin whereby its calling the enablePluginModule() to enable some plugin modules. Also we've tried to call enablePluginModule() in different plugins for testing purpose, they're all facing the same issue.
4. Since 5.10.
5. I guess it's reproducible in both the production and dev environment as well with MenuManager v3.0.0.

Attached with the Confluence logs.

Anyway, we improved the MenuManager and it is not facing this issue anymore, you can edit this issue to a lower priority but I assume other Confluence plugins that used this enablePluginModule function will bump into this issue.
fields.summary: PluginController's enablePluginModule is taking too long to execute

fields.description:
Confluence Cloud: Gliffy Add-on not available immediately after very first install on a freshly provisioned instance of confluence cloud. We suspect that this might be an issue around synchrony.  

JavaScript Error:
{noformat}
21:24:33.434 synchrony.atlassian.io/v1/data/-cffcb1a4-5dd3-3d28-90e9-75be0180b495/confluence-229377?state-at=@head&state-format=type-tagged&rewrite-request=true&cached=true:1 POST https://synchrony.atlassian.io/v1/data/-cffcb1a4-5dd3-3d28-90e9-75be0180b495/confluence-229377?state-at=@head&state-format=type-tagged&rewrite-request=true&cached=true 404 ()
{noformat}

h6. Here are the steps to reproduce.
# I create a new trial Confluence
# I add a trial version of the Gliffy plugin.
# When I create my first page, I see a 404 error to synchrony.atlassian.io
# I try to create a Gliffy macro, and get the no macro meta-data error, the end point we define for our custom macro editor in the atlassian-descriptor.json is never called.
# I create a new page
# I do not see the 404 error to synchrony.atlassian.io 
# I am now able to add a Gliffy macro.

See attached image that shows 404 error and also JavaScript log for the entire repro session
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud: Gliffy Add-on not available immediately after install

fields.description:
Content name search sometime restrict results only on set of category types e.g. spacedesc, personalspacedesc. The restriction is given in ContentNameSearchContext#types. It expects that CustomContentQuickNavSearchProvider will honor the restriction and return only contents  of the given types.

Failure to honor it results in bug such as https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-54689.

I advice studying the DefaultContentNameSearchSectionsProvider in confluence core and make necessary correction.
fields.summary: CustomContentQuickNavSearchProvider doesn't honor category types given in  ContentNameSearchContext#types

fields.description:

{noformat}confluence.saveMacro({'url': data.url});{noformat}
*Expected* Any body in the macro is left untouched
*Actual* The macro body is replaced with an empty string

See: https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/javascript/module-confluence.html#.saveMacro
fields.summary: Using confluence.saveMacro overwrites body when omitted

fields.description:
Our add-on can no longer download attachments using the attachment download url in IE 11 through AP.request.  One of our developers discovered that attachment download is performing a 301 redirect to a CND to get the attachment.  According to this forum post, it looks there's an issue with IE 11, where a 30 1will result in a 404 error:

https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/ie/en-US/1f9d55c8-5495-4e35-9d6f-3adc6dba89cc/ie-11-wont-display-pages-with-301-redirects?forum=ieitprocurrentver

We are adding work arounds for this issue, but please investigate and remedy if possible.
fields.summary: Cannot download attachments in IE 11 using AP.request

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The {{page_viewed}} webhook fires inconsistently.

h3. Environment
Replicated in
* goodsoftware.atlassian.net (prod)
* goodsoftwarestaging.atlassian.net (dev)
* goodsoftwaredev2.atlassian.net (dev)
* testian.atlassian.net (dev)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install an add-on that registers for "page_viewed" webhooks
# View a Confluence page
# Observe that the page_viewed webhook hasn't fired


h3. Expected Results
Webhook consistently fires

h3. Actual Results
Webhook intermittently fires

h3. Notes
* This is a _critical_ issue for us. Without this our Analytics add-on is useless and we're missing key data every moment this isn't working that our customers rely upon.
* Add-on affected: Analytics for Confluence Cloud
* Works as expected in ADG2 land. Fails on ADG3.
fields.summary: Confluence page_viewed webhook is mostly failing

fields.description:
We started receiving reports over night that the Gliffy editor cannot load.  This is affects all none english users.  The failure is happening due to a react.js script error in with-translation.js.  I have attached a screen shot of the error.  

This looks likes like it's due to a recent Confluence cloud update.  We do not use react on our code base.  Also, our last deployment to cloud was Friday, afternoon, so I would have expected to start receiving reports sooner, given the severity.  

Please look into this issue ASAP, this is a major service affecting event.

fields.description:
page.id and other page params are deprecated. However, for a dynamicContentMacro, content.id and other content params do not work. These are supposed to replace page.id and so on.

My plugin macro has a url at this address: 
{noformat}/macro-page?space_key={space.key}&page_id={page.id}&content_version={content.version}&content_id={content.id}{noformat}

space.key and page.id work fine, but content.id and content.version give blank results.

I would also really appreciate if it was possible to get the page's title from params, e.g. content.title.
fields.summary: Content.id context params do not work for macros

fields.description:
I've been running through and tagging Hipchat's AWS infrastructure. We have some ebs snapshots that alfred is complaining about, and I believe this to be in error.

It's likely either the presence of a : or a / in the name however BOTH a colon, and a forward slash are permissible characters according to AWS: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Using_Tags.html  " Note
If you plan to use a tagging schema across multiple services and resources, keep in mind that while there are no restrictions on special characters for Amazon EC2, other services may have different restrictions or limits. Generally allowed characters are: letters, spaces, and numbers representable in UTF-8, plus the following special characters: + - = . _ : / @. "


Please let us know if you agree that this is an error, or if you've updated the tagging guidelines EAC page to reflect reserved characters, so that we can proceed with the tagging of AWS resources.
fields.summary: alfred doesn't like the value of 'Name' tag containing either a ':' or a '/'

fields.description:
This is the stacktrace that we get:

{noformat}
.confluence.user.listeners.UserSessionExpiryListener@1975eaf]] from the invoker [com.atlassian.confluence.event.ConfluenceListenerHandlersConfiguration$TimingListenerHandler$1$1@1c6e43e]
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449046500 java.lang.RuntimeException: null value
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449145500 	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:54)

2016-02-05 10:09:11.449161500 	at org.apache.catalina.session.StandardSession.expire(StandardSession.java:809)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449162500 	at org.apache.catalina.session.StandardSession.isValid(StandardSession.java:657)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449163500 	at org.apache.catalina.session.PersistentManagerBase.processExpires(PersistentManagerBase.java:442)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449164500 	at org.apache.catalina.session.ManagerBase.backgroundProcess(ManagerBase.java:566)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449166500 	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.backgroundProcess(ContainerBase.java:1352)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449167500 	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$ContainerBackgroundProcessor.processChildren(ContainerBase.java:1546)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449171500 	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$ContainerBackgroundProcessor.processChildren(ContainerBase.java:1556)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449172500 	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$ContainerBackgroundProcessor.processChildren(ContainerBase.java:1556)

2016-02-05 10:09:11.449175500 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449175500 Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: null value
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449176500 	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:204)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449177500 	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap.entryOf(ImmutableMap.java:139)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449177500 	at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap.of(ImmutableMap.java:106)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449180500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.connect.confluence.webhook.SecurityEventMapper.toMap(SecurityEventMapper.java:30)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449181500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.connect.confluence.webhook.ConfluenceEventSerializerFactory.create(ConfluenceEventSerializerFactory.java:59)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449182500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.connect.confluence.webhook.ConfluenceEventSerializerFactory.create(ConfluenceEventSerializerFactory.java:22)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449186500 	at com.atlassian.webhooks.plugin.legacy.WebHookRegistration.getEventSerializer(WebHookRegistration.java:40)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449187500 	at com.atlassian.webhooks.plugin.legacy.OsgiWebHookProviderRegistry$WebHookProviderWaitableServiceTrackerCustomizer$1.serialize(OsgiWebHookProviderRegistry.java:52)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449188500 	at com.atlassian.webhooks.plugin.module.WebHookEventSerializer.serialize(WebHookEventSerializer.java:32)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449195500 	at com.atlassian.webhooks.plugin.PublishTaskFactoryImpl.getEventBody(PublishTaskFactoryImpl.java:64)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449195500 	at com.atlassian.webhooks.plugin.PublishTaskFactoryImpl.getPublishTask(PublishTaskFactoryImpl.java:52)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449196500 	at com.atlassian.webhooks.plugin.WebHookPublisherImpl.publish(WebHookPublisherImpl.java:94)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449197500 	at com.atlassian.webhooks.plugin.WebHookPublisherImpl.publish(WebHookPublisherImpl.java:69)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449199500 	at com.atlassian.webhooks.plugin.WebHookEventsProcessor.doOnEvent(WebHookEventsProcessor.java:41)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449200500 	at com.atlassian.webhooks.plugin.WebHookEventsProcessor.onEvent(WebHookEventsProcessor.java:34)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449201500 	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor109.invoke(Unknown Source)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449206500 	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449207500 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449207500 	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:36)
2016-02-05 10:09:11.449208500 	... 18 more
{noformat}

Looking at the code it seems that in Confluence we do this (com.atlassian.confluence.user.listeners.UserSessionExpiryListener#sessionDestroyed):

{code}
            Principal user = (Principal) event.getSession().getAttribute(DefaultAuthenticator.LOGGED_IN_KEY);
            
            String username = user != null ? user.getName() : null;
            getEventPublisher().publish(SessionDestroyedEvent.builder()
                    .sessionId(event.getSession().getId())
                    .userName(username)
                    .build());
{code}

And the username string gets set to null. Then, in atlassian-connect we do this (com.atlassian.plugin.connect.confluence.webhook.SecurityEventMapper#toMap):

{code}
        return ImmutableMap.<String, Object>of(
            "timestamp", e.getTimestamp(),
            "user", event.getUsername(),
            "remoteHost", event.getRemoteHost(),
            "remoteIP", event.getRemoteIP()
        );
{code}

Since the username is null the immutableMap errors out. We should either:

* Fix Confluence so that the username is never passed through as null.
* Fix Atlassian Connect to not place the username field on the Security Event in the case that it is missing.

Also, I am not sure what other affects this has.

This issue is a blocker for release.
fields.summary: User session expiring is causing NPE to be thrown in the logs

fields.description:
Hello...

From this morning, if I edit a page with an HTML table macro, the comments appear on the right hand side of the page, leaving only a small area for the actual page... Probably best to look at the image.

Easily produced:

# Create a test page
# Add an HTML table macro
# Put a table in the HTML table macro area
# Add a confluence table to that macro (you're not supposed to do this actually, you are only meant to insert row/cell html macros.)
# Save page
# Edit page --> weirdness!

Chrome 50.0.2661.94 (64-bit)
fields.summary: HTML Table macro breaks editor when embedded with a normal table

fields.description:
Url:
{noformat}
 "url": "/ap3/file?fileId={fileId}&showLink={showLink}&width=800&height=600&type=slide",
{noformat}               

Macro def:
{noformat}
{
  "identifier": "showLink",
  "name": { "value": "Show document link" },
  "description": { "value": "Show document link" },
  "type": "boolean",
  "required": false,
  "defaultValue": "true"
}
{noformat}

Actual:
When {{showLink}} is ticked, no value is sent, but when {{showLink}} is not ticked false is sent

Expected:
The value of {{showLink}} is correctly replaced in the URL regardless of the default setting.

fields.description:
As a developer I would like the default values to be filled when fetching the colour scheme using the REST API.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Set a value in the colour scheme settings to blank and save
2. The value should be auto-filled as a default
3. Fetch the colour scheme using the REST API

Expected result
The JSON from the REST API contains the default value.

Actual result
The JSON contains no value for the set parameter.
fields.summary: Setting empty values in colour scheme leads to empty values in REST API

fields.description:
See Connect doc:
* https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/javascript/module-Confluence.html
* https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/fragment/macro-editor.html

The doc says about macroBody of saveMacro:
"the macro body to be saved with the macro. If omitted, the existing body will remain untouched."

My macro has a custom editor dialog. When I insert my macro, the dialog is displayed.

In the dialog close handler, I set macro params without body like this:
confluence.saveMacro(macroParams);

There will be NPE:
user-activity-xhr-header.js:54
POST http://localhost:8080/wiki/rest/tinymce/1/macro/placeholder 500 (Internal Server Error)

Stacktrace:
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException: Missing storage body
	at java.util.Objects.requireNonNull(Objects.java:228)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.definition.RichTextMacroBody.withStorage(RichTextMacroBody.java:18)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.tinymceplugin.rest.MacroResource.getMacroBody(MacroResource.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.tinymceplugin.rest.MacroResource.generatePlaceHolder(MacroResource.java:134)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
{noformat}

Note:
There won't be NPE if I call like this (with empty macro body):
confluence.saveMacro(macroParams, '');

Related issues:
* AC-2306
* AC-2307
fields.summary: Insert macro with custom editor dialog: saveMacro without body causes NPE

fields.description:
Content property search extractions allow Connect add-ons to integrate with search in Confluence. In instances that have been migrated to our newer infrastructure platform, these are not working.

To reproduce, create an add-on that defines Content property search extractions, create some content properties against a page, and try to query for those using CQL.

Comalatech first raised this in https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-282964.

The feature is described here:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/fragment/content-property-index-extraction-configuration.html
fields.summary: Confluence search integration broken for some instances

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Emulate a slow internet connection (can be done in the chrome dev-tools)
# Now open up a wiki page which contains a byline app
# Click on the byline link while the page is still loading

*What happens*

You will get redirected to a 404 page. Probably the logic which calls `preventDefault()` for the link has not been executed yet at that point in time.

*What should happen*

The byline link should get rendered in a later point in time. Basically when the application is able to render the inline-dialog after a user has clicked the link.

*Side note*

I run into this problem regularly, even with a fast internet connection.
fields.summary: Byline links reference to 404 pages if a user has a slow internet connection

fields.description:
I created a basic Confluence Dialog, when I run the add-on and open the dialog, I get an empty dialog (without the Web Item module inside), and an *internal server error 500*.
In confluence logs, there is a null pointer exception like follows : 


{code:java}
--------------------------
Parameters
--------------------------
height : 100%
ui-params : eyJpc0RpYWxvZyI6MX0=
width : 100%
classifier : raw
_ : 1428325884968
plugin-key : spectrumgroupe.addon.glossary.cloud
product-context : {"page.version":"1","page.type":"page","user.key":"4028818a4bba33ae014bba33c1ab0002","space.id":"6619142","page.title":"Glossaire Dashboard","macro.truncated":"false","space.key":"AS","output.type":"display",": = | RAW | = :":null,"page.id":"6422623","macro.hash":"d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e","user.id":"admin","macro.body":""}
key : confirm-delete
caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.plugin.connect.plugin.util.RequestJsonParameterUtil.toStringArray(RequestJsonParameterUtil.java:150)
{code}

My theory is that the url sent by confluence to get the dialog module is too long, here it is : 


{code:java}
http://localhost:1990/confluence/plugins/servlet/ac/spectrumgroupe-addon-glossary-cloud/confirm-delete?ui-params=eyJpc0RpYWxvZyI6MX0%3D&plugin-key=spectrumgroupe-addon-glossary-cloud&product-context=%7B%22page.version%22%3A%221%22%2C%22page.type%22%3A%22page%22%2C%22user.key%22%3A%224028818a4bba33ae014bba33c1ab0002%22%2C%22space.id%22%3A%226619147%22%2C%22page.title%22%3A%22Glossaire+Dashboard%22%2C%22macro.truncated%22%3A%22false%22%2C%22space.key%22%3A%22AS%22%2C%22output.type%22%3A%22display%22%2C%22%3A+%3D+%7C+RAW+%7C+%3D+%3A%22%3Anull%2C%22page.id%22%3A%226750213%22%2C%22macro.hash%22%3A%22d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e%22%2C%22user.id%22%3A%22admin%22%2C%22macro.body%22%3A%22%22%7D&key=confirm-delete&width=100%25&height=100%25&classifier=raw&_=1428337116143

fields.description: To ensure the Space API is in line with the Space Permissions UI, we need to ensure the mappings of our internal permissions objects to the external space JSON blob make sense. fields.summary: Edit blog space permission is mapped to update, should be mapped to create

fields.description:
If you provide a dataUri for a content property ui component, you must match the format exactly or a low level javascript error is produced.

*v5 error:*
 !Screenshot 2017-02-21 19.04.57.png|thumbnail! 

*v3 error:*
 !Screenshot 2017-02-21 19.03.22.png|thumbnail! 

Content Property extractions, uiSupport.

This documentation: https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/fragment/user-interface-support.html#dataUri

* Suggests to return an array of options, this is incorrect.  It needs to return an object with two fields {{suggestedResults}} and {{searchResults}}.
* The {{suggestedResults}} and {{searchResults}} should follow the example (object of id and text).
* It's unclear what each field exactly represents but i think its like this:
** suggestedResults - anything relevant to the user but doesn't need to match the {{query}} param
** searchResults - a subset of the data set matching the {{query}} param
fields.summary: Error handling in dataUri processing

fields.description:
Repeat:
1. Create an add-on using webPanel with location atl.editor.savebar (our add-on uses this location as a work around for issue https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/CE-1086)
2. Open a page in view mode
3. Wait some time (at least a minute, more than expiry time of JWT tokens used for add-on iframe URL verification)
4. Enter edit mode
-> Now the add-on is loaded with an iframe URL that has an expired JWT token as verification

Confluence should make sure that the tokens are valid when the add-on iframe is loaded.

Refreshing page (manually or with AP.navigator.reload() ) solves the problem, but programmatically reloading the editor is not a smooth solution (especially since reload is quite slow).

There are some closed issues that seem related, eg. https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AC-2205
fields.summary: Add-on is sometimes loaded with expired iframe URL JWT token (webPanel with location atl.editor.savebar)

fields.description:
This issue captures the problems Bob Swift and team have been experiencing over the past months (first raised early 2017). 

https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-295208
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-56853

Bob and Appfire have been seeing 500 errors from the REST API for a while now. These only occur during running their automated test suites, and only when firing lots of requests (100+) in quick succession.

Apparently, the instance of these issues has increased since the instances have been migrated from Unicorn to Vertigo.

See the linked issues for more details on the specifics of the requests/responses.
fields.summary: REST API responding with 500 when called in succession

fields.description:
Confluence sometimes (about 3% of views) pass empty values for parameters in dynamic content macros view controller. It is not stable behavior and often it is enough just to reload a Confluence page to fix the issue.

We also see that in such cases Confluence pass page.id & page.version, but don't pass macro.id.

We've started to experience the issue about 2 months ago and it is quite critical for us because our clients think that this our issue.

Part of our log (just an example). We expect to get values for "url", "widht" and "height" parameters here.

{code}
"GET /view?id=gdrive_embedded_file&url=&width=&height=&tz=America%2FNew_York&loc=en-GB&
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence sometimes pass empty values for parameters in dynamic content macros view contoller

fields.description: When converting a {{jira}} macro for a single issue from storage to EXPORT_VIEW HTML using the {{contentbody/convert/export_view}} REST API, the image urls are not properly replaced. Instead the velocity expressions are included in the HTML. Furthermore the issue summary is not included. {code:title=Example Storage Format} K15t Software key,summary,type,created,updated,due,assignee,reporter,priority,status,resolution 61b6191d-d412-3043-a96c-75b7bceaed1f EXP-421 {code} {code:title=Resulting EXPORT_VIEW HTML} EXP-421 ( ) {code} The velocity expressions {{$iconUrl}} and {{$statusIcon}} were not replaced. Therefore these image do not appear at all.
fields.summary: Missing summary and invalid image urls in jira macros when converting storage to EXPORT_VIEW

Details here:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-232994
fields.summary: Colgroup macro not rendering properly

fields.description:
h2. Summary

In CE-930 we added the ability for the version of embedded content to be specified when rendering a different version of the outer page in the API, and exposed it as a query parameter on the view page in CE-969. 

In some cases, the {{version-at-save}} setting is not being honoured by this in the view format, and the src url on the image tag is missing a {{version}} parameter. This causes the latest version of the image to be rendered, not the version at the time the outer page was saved.

h2. Technical Investigation
This issue doesn't pop up all the time because in some cases {{DefaultAttachedImageResourceMarshaller}} is called and it works correctly (such as in the bamboo builds) and in some cases {{DynamicSizeAttachedImageResourceMarshaller}} is called and it doesn't work. We've traced this issue into {{DynamicSizeAttachedImageResourceMarshaller.buildUrl}}. For some reason this calls {{Downloadable.getDownloadPathWithoutVersionOrApiRevision()}}, which is missing the context of the version.
fields.summary: Version attribute not added for images rendered using embeddedContentRender=version-at-save

fields.description:
In draw.io we have a custom macro editor for a dynamic content macro. In order to implement auto-save we need to add a temporary attachment with the draft revision of the diagram.

So that the draft of the page recovers properly, the macro has to be changed to point at the draft attachment when diagram editing starts and then back at the main attachment when editing finishes.

We found when making 2 saveMacro calls, the second saveMacro call does not change the macro (aside from the first edit of the macro).

Our SSCCE is at https://github.com/davidjgraph/saveMacroTest. Install it to a test Confluence and insert a {saveMacro} to a page. Edit the macro and that will open a dummy dialog. At this point https://github.com/davidjgraph/saveMacroTest/blob/master/macroEditor.html#L57 is called, saving the macro with the "count" macro parameter at "1".

On exiting the dialog with "submit", https://github.com/davidjgraph/saveMacroTest/blob/master/macroEditor.html#L44 is called, this attempts to save the macro with the "count" macro parameter at "2", but the value in the macro remains at "1".

The console (in Chrome and Firefox) prints out "The node to be replaced has been already deleted from the document". If you comment out the first saveMacro call on line 57 of macroEditor.html, the second call then works, the parameter value is correctly set to "2" and the console message about the node is gone.

The preferred result is that the second saveMacro change the macro correctly.
fields.summary: Second saveMacro call within custom macro editor fails

fields.description: See attached screenshot. This issue was brought up by Adaptavist via email, and I've reproduced on my Connect Development instance.
fields.summary: Custom Content missing icon in sidebar
Content search REST API returning 500

fields.description:
*Expected:* Performing a search via the Confluence interface fires a {{search_performed}} webhook (this would be consistent with the Atlassian Connect documentation).

*Actual:* No webhooks are fired.

h3. Possible solutions
Matt Jensen: The site search function calls /rest/api/experimental/search which does not fire the search event.
* Fix is to add the fire event option, or
* Upgrade to use the more recent /rest/api/search method.

https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/projects/DEVHELP/queues/custom/173/DEVHELP-645

h3. Steps
# Install a cloud add-on that handles the "search_performed" webhook
# Do a search in Confluence via the top menu bar (adg2) / sidebar (adg3) and ensure the search takes you to the search page (dosearchsite.action)
# Observe that no web request for the search_performed webhook comes through

h3. Notes
They don't appear to be working on the following Confluence instances (some adg3 and some adg2, some dev some not):
https://goodsoftwaredev.atlassian.net/wiki
https://goodsoftwaredev2.atlassian.net/wiki
https://goodsoftwaredevbeta.atlassian.net/wiki
https://goodsoftware.atlassian.net/wiki
https:/addontestzone.atlassian.net/wiki
I've confirmed in production they are working on some customer instances e.g:
"af2727ad-44c0-3344-8fd9-aed9947b831b"
"Confluence:1079849603"
"Confluence:8468258078"
Logs show that the working customer instances have "Confluence-1000.1726.1 (6452)" in the user agent string on the webhook request."
fields.summary: Confluence search does not send a 'search_performed' webhook
Confluence web resources not loaded since depended on by disabled ac/confluence/macro resource

fields.description: When opening a custom Connect Macro editor such as Gliffy, the connect api create a marker (aka bookmark) inside the editor which looks like {code} ﻿﻿﻿ {code} When the dialog is closed without any interaction (canceled), AP.confluence.closeMacroEditor() closes the dialog without removing the marker. Hence, any subsequent keys in happen inside the marker, which subsequently ignored when saving, causing lost of data. In case of inserting a new macro (AP.confluence.saveMacro()), the marker is replaced by the macro placeholder so everything is fine. Expectation: the marker should be removed upon AP.confluence.closeMacroEditor() call.
fields.summary: AP.confluence.closeMacroEditor()

fields.description:
Error in console: GET https://[INSTANCE URL]/wiki/rest/api/content/undefined/history/undefined/macro/id/undefined?_=1488555383729 404 ()
P.S. works fine on "Edit macro" dialog.
fields.summary: AP.confluence.getMacroBody doesn't work on "Insert macro" dialog (confluence)

fields.description:
Rendering of pages having many static connect macros (without caching) can cause a gateway timeout if the rendering takes longer than 60 seconds. We ran into this when one of our customers exported a single page having a lot of multi-excerpt macros (those are static connect macros). Calling the /contentbody/convert/export_view REST API apparently took longer than one minute so the gateway closed the connection. This is a critical issue for us, because customers don't think of timeouts when adding (connect) macros on their pages. *Steps to reproduce:* # Install an addon providing a 'dummy' static content macro that sleeps three seconds (contact [~cli@atlassian.com] for this)  # Insert 20 of the dummy macros into a Confluence page. Alternatively, POST the following JSON containing twenty of these macros to {{/wiki/rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view}} {code:java} { "value" : "

before

after

", "representation" : "storage" }{code} # You'll run into a '504 Gateway Time-out' after exactly one minute. *Investigation Results:*  I think the problem is that currently the Confluence page waits for all macros on the page to send back a response before rendering all of them. Because of this, when one macro times out, the entire page cannot be rendered. *Solution:* Refer to Steven's comment.
fields.summary: 'HTTP 504 Gateway Time-out' when storage-to-view converting pages with many static connect macros
